column4: anyone here know of any supported SATA addon cards for ubuntu? I don't have any onboard SATA Ports and would like to use a SATA drive.
most should work
how would I know what does/doesn't work?
http://linuxmafia.com/faq/Hardware/sata.html
yep usually the connection keeps alive when you shut down X
sudo /etc/init.d/gdm stop
it is installed by default afaik
you can safely ignore that error
I have other messages of the same style in dmesg as well
yes there are two one from "sd" and one from "sr" ?
correct
both equally harmless afaik
you have any idea how to tell if I have the proper video driver installed?
which graphic card?
its integrated on the mobo. Any way to tell?
lspci | grep -i vga
01:00.0 VGA compatible controller: Silicon Integrated Systems [SiS] 661/741/760 PCI/AGP or 662/761Gx PCIE VGA Display Adapter (rev 03)
well i spect the system to use the right driver... but you can check the /var/log/Xorg.0.log to make sure
xserver-xorg-video-sis is already the newest version
sorry wrong channel
